meanings.sent1: The sly fox was gulling the rabbit into thinking it was safe to come out of its burrow.
meanings.sent2: She was gulling her friends by pretending to be sick so they would do her homework for her.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was gulling the birds by pretending to be asleep, waiting for the perfect moment to pounce.
meanings.sent4: The con artist was gulling unsuspecting victims with promises of quick riches.
meanings.sent5: The magician's tricks were so convincing that he seemed to be gulling reality itself.

meanings.definition: The act of deceiving or tricking someone
meanings.sent1: The gulling of the innocent villagers by the cunning thief was finally exposed.
meanings.sent2: She saw through his gulling and refused to fall for his lies.
meanings.sent3: The gulling of the students by the prankster caused chaos in the classroom.
meanings.sent4: The gulling of the audience by the illusionist left everyone in awe.
meanings.sent5: The gulling of the detective by the mastermind criminal was a plot twist no one saw coming.
